name: Pork Fried Rice
author: Olies
summary: This is my revised version of another pork fried rice recipe. I often substitute chicken for pork, and it doesn't change anything. I have used both basmati rice and long-grain rice which gives the dish only a slight flavor difference. I have also added celery in the past with good outcomes. Enjoy.
ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) boneless pork loin chop, cut into small pieces
directions: Melt butter in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat
Cook and stir pork, carrot, broccoli, peas, and green onion in melted butter until pork is cooked through, 7 to 10 minutes
Remove pork mixture to a bowl and return skillet to medium heat
Scramble egg in the skillet until completely set
Return the pork mixture to the skillet
Stir rice, peas, soy sauce, garlic powder, and ground ginger into the pork mixture; cook and stir until heated through, 7 to 10 minutes
